Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Sentinels of Order
Description:
Chaos corrupts all, but it does not go unopposed. The forces of Order fight to reclaim what’s been taken, including the Allpoints, as the lands of the Varanspire were once known. Small forces are even now testing the defences of their infernal foes, infiltrating those blasted lands through stealth and guile. Every champion of the Ruinous Powers slain is a victory to be celebrated, every ancient relic liberated a gift for civilisation. Now it’s up to you – resist and reclaim!

Sentinels of Order  is the essential guide to commanding the forces of Grand Alliance: Order in games of Warcry. 12 warbands are detailed in full, from the noble Chambers of the Stormcast Eternals to mysterious aelves and sturdy duardin. You’ll find loads of new fighter cards, background tables, Fated Quests, and Challenge Battles – in short, everything you need to play the forces of Order in full campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:


     Full rules for the following warbands: Cities of Sigmar, Daughters of Khaine, Idonenth Deepkin, Khainite Shadowstalkers, Kharadron Overlords, Lumineth Realm-lords, Fyreslayers, Seraphon, Sylvaneth, Stormcast Eternals Sacrosanct Chamber, Stormcast Eternals Warrior Chamber, and Stormcast Eternals Vanguard Auxiliary Chamber.
     Fighter cards for nearly every model available to the Grand Alliance: Order ranges.
     Rules for two Monsters of Order: War Hydra and Kharibdyss.
     Refined rules to include Monsters in your warband, as well as new abilities to use against them!
     New rules for warbands with mixed Faction Runemarks under the same Grand Alliance and more than one Leader.
     Tables for warrior names, warband origins, and leader backgrounds.
     4 Order Fated Quests, including Spoils of Victory tables for both Honour and Glory.
     6 Order Challenge Battles, including special rules and valuable Spoils.
     Blank roster sheets to copy and fill.


If you yearn to take the fight to the eternal enemy of Order, this 112-page softback book is for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Doblete
Description:
A memory game to enjoy classic tales along with the best known literary characters.

4 ways to play. You can search for the same characters or try to find the literary pairs. Make a fantastic pair or play it in “Chancho va!” mode.

Name: Myriorama: La Biblioteca Infinita
Description:
An ideal game to create and tell endless stories!

Seven game suggestions. The myrioramas can be created individually, in groups or collaboratively, and the stories can be told orally or in writing.

Name: I Am Not The Thief!
Description:
On a stormy night, the mysterious package arrives. The lights go out. When the power is restored, the lights flicker on to reveal that the box has been ripped open and its contents stolen. All of us have something with us in our backpacks, handbags, satchels, etc., but one of us is The Thief.

The Thief must make up a story about why they have the stolen item to fool the innocent. The innocent use a prompt to explain why they have their item and try to catch The Thief!

Each player has a card sleeve with a picture of there item that shows a picture of the item and a prompt for a story about why they have it. The Thief has a sleeve that blocks the prompt.

Name: Biddabbell
Description:
Abstract set collection/simultaneous auction game.

Each turn, a card from hand is played to bid on order of choice.  In choice order, take one of the cards in the market. At the end of each turn, cards used to bid will be added to the market.

At the end, cards remaining in hand determin how your sets score.

This game was entered into the 2020 ELL deck design competition and was deemed joint-winner (along with Invizibell).

Name: Heißes Brezel-Rennen
Description:
7 baked goods that have not yet been baked (rolls, baguettes, etc.) are on their way to the ovens. At the beginning, each player makes a prediction as to which goods will end up in which oven. In turn, any 3 of the color dice are rolled (each die represents a baked good) and the corresponding goods are moved towards the ovens, provided they are not blocked by other goods. As soon as a good reaches the oven area, it is pushed into the first free oven. As soon as all ovens are filled with goods, the checkout takes place. For each correct prediction, points are awarded according to the oven (between 1 for the first and 4 for the last one). The player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Flohmarkt
Description:
In a round trip, the dice are rolled sometimes clockwise, sometimes counterclockwise. You can move with all the game pieces. If you arrive at a stand where the flea market item cards with the values 1-15 are displayed, you roll all three color dice to determine the price of the item. The price is written down on a piece of paper. The first player to sell items for Fr. 80 or more is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Spionage
Description:
Each player has 15 agents, 4 bases and 1 robot. The game is played on a playing field with a network of paths over which you move your pieces and on which you can set up bases. The player whose turn it is rolls 2 dice and can convert the points rolled into: Movement of the individual agents (1 dice point each), deployment of the robot (9 dice points), establishment of a base (6 dice points), air strike (10 dice points), air landing (12 dice points). In addition, it is possible to waive the dice roll and save additional dice points for an action in the next round. For this, however, the action of the next round must be announced and also executed. The player who first manages to occupy 3 squares in the opponent's headquarters by eliminating foreign agents wins the game.

—user summary

Name: StoryWorld: NSFW Expansion Pack
Description:
A perfect choice for a party game, where the stories can become a little more intense. This will add even more fun to the game, just dont be afraid to tell your must hidden secrets!

44 new cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: StoryWorld: Horror Expansion Pack
Description: Tell the most terrifying stories and create moments of true horror with your friends. Solve the mystery of a haunted house or face a wave of zombies, everything depends on you and your imagination! 44 new cards!

Name: StoryWorld: Fantasy Expansion Pack
Description: Enter a world full of magical and powerful creatures, where everything is different from reality. Be ready to travel through magical portals and discover new worlds! 44 new cards!

Name: The Game of the Hen
Description: Learn the seasonality by playing and answering questions on sustainable lifestyle and the cycle of the seasons, but also miming and drawing. Developed exclusively by Lo Scarabeo to Eataly - the widest space in the world devoted to excellence Italian food and wine - a game for the whole family to enjoy together.

Name: United States Visiting Forces Supplement for Threat Level: Emergency Response
Description:
This product is an extra to the main rulebook. 
The main rulebook is required to understand this product.

This book contains keywords and stat cards to make the game easier to understand.

Threat Level:Emergency Response is a battle system focused on British Police, Paramedics and Fire Brigades. 
With This supplement, it adds United States Air Force in Europe into the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: L'Italia s'è desta!
Description:
L'Italia s'è desta!, Italy has woken up!: 
these Wargame rules are created to simulate the Italian wars of independence, without being too complicated.

To play you need a playing field.
The terrain scale varies per scenario, the reference is 1:5.500.

Turn Sequence:

     Impulse of Player A:
         Bombardment phase
         Shooting phase
         Maneuvering phase and charges
         Melee Combat Phase
    
     Impulse of Player B:
     Repeat the above

Name: Łódź 1914
Description:
The game covers a clash between German, Austro-Hungarian and Russian armies. It is divided in three scenarios, covering different stages of the battle. Each stage has different objectives, marked by victory points. Supply plays a key role, when planning offensives on enemy soil.

A fourth scenario combines map and units from this game with the map and units from Tannenberg 1914 and covers the Second Battle of Masurian Lakes.

Rules:
The game is using the WB-95 system, which contains additions related to the time period. This rule-set is the base for WB-48.
Families: Series: Wielkie Bitwy 1939-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: Su Le Teste ! Le guerre napoleoniche: Nuova Edizione
Description:
Su le Teste!  ("Up the heads") is a historical miniature wargame for Napoleonic battles and campaigns from 1805 to 1815.

The rules brings all the charm of Napoleonic military exploits on the tabletop,.

A playful work dedicated to the men of those times and aimed at players with a taste for simulation with miniature historical wargames. 
A laborious work animated by a passion for history and forged by decades of experience.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar General's Handbook Pitched Battles 2021
Description:
The essential 2021 General’s Handbook is an invaluable supplement that enhances your games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar. This year’s edition is divided into two separate books – the General’s Handbook comes as a 96-page ring-bound hardback, while the Pitched Battle Profiles book is a 34-page softback.

Inside this year’s General’s Handbook, you'll find…


     High-level background information on Ghur, the Realm of Beasts, which is the setting for this General's Handbook and Pitched Battle Season.
     A focused description of the war of Thondia, the area in Ghur which is in the midst of desperate conflict. Thondia is key to the current narrative of Warhammer Age of Sigmar, and is part of the setting for this General's Handbook and Pitched Battle Season.
     Rules for a new Region of War – The Ghurrish Heartlands – which include two special rules (Predators and Prey and Seismic Shift), one additional Realmsphere Magic spell available to all Wizards (Metamorphosis), and one additional Realm Command which all players have access to (Feral Roar).
     Two additional core battalions that players can include in their army in addition to the Core Battalions included in the core rules: Alpha-Beast Pack and Hunters of the Heartlands.
     Rules for eight grand strategies that dictate what an army will try and achieve during the battle. They offer additional victory points if completed by the end of the game: Sever the Head, Hold the Line, Vendetta, Dominating Presence, Beast Master, Prized Sorcery, Pillars of Belief, and Predator's Domain.
     Rules for eight battle tactics that can be used to determine who won the game. They reflect commands given by the leaders of the army over the course of the battle, and represent the army trying to achieve certain goals on the field of battle each turn: Broken Ranks, Conquer, Slay the Warlord, Ferocious Advance, Savage Spearhead, Aggressive Expansion, Monstrous Takeover, and Bring It Down!
     A photocopiable scoring sheet, designed to keep track of the various objectives throughout the battle.
     Guidance on the minimum accepted standard for using miniatures in Pitched Battle games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar.
     12 battleplans for the Pitched Battle 2021 season: Marking Territory, Savage Gains, First Blood, Power Struggle, Survival of the Fittest, Tectonic Interference, Apex Predators, The Vice, Tooth and Nail, Feral Foray, Power in Numbers, and The Veins of Ghur.
     A list of all the official publications which can be used when building an army for use in Pitched Battles.
     Updated warscrolls for the following 17 endless spells: Horrorghast, Aethervoid Pendulum, Chronomantic Cogs, Emerald Lifeswarm, Geminids of Uhl-Gysh, Malevolent Maelstrom, Prismatic Palisade, Purple Sun of Shyish, Quicksilver Swords, Ravenak's Gnashing Jaws, Soulsnare Shackles, Suffocating Gravetide, The Burning Head, Umbral Spellportal, Soulscream Bridge, Shards of Valagharr, and Lauchon the Soulseeker.
     The Warhammer Age of Sigmar core rules


Please note: The ring-bound design of the General’s Handbook and layout of the battleplans have been designed so that the book can be folded flat to save space, while still providing an overview of the essential information to easily reference once the game has begun.

Inside this year’s Pitched Battle Profiles book, you'll find…


     An introduction to Pitched Battle Profiles and descriptions of the four different types of battlefield role: Artillery, Battleline, Behemoth, and Leader.
     Details on how to use allies in Pitched Battles in the 2021 Season
     Updated Pitched Battle Profiles for every unit, faction, and Grand Alliance in Warhammer Age of Sigmar, as follows:


Order: Cities of Sigmar, Daughters of Khaine, Fyreslayers, Idoneth Deepkin, Kharadron Overlords, Lumineth Realm-lords, Seraphon, Stormcast Eternals, and Sylvaneth.

Chaos: Beasts of Chaos, Blades of Khorne, Disciples of Tzeentch, Hedonites of Slaanesh, Maggotkin of Nurgle, Skaven, and Slaves to Darkness.

Death: Flesh-eater Courts, Nighthaunt, Ossiarch Bonereapers, and Soulblight Gravelords.

Destruction: Gloomspite Gitz, Ogor Mawtribes, Orruk Warclans, and Sons of Behemat.


     Updated Pitched Battle profiles for the 17 endless spells from Malign Sorcery and Forbidden Power.


PLUS:
The General’s Handbook 2021 also comes with a card token board, which contains 14 double-sided tokens as follows:


     10x Objective / Prime Objectives
     1x Battle Tactic Token – Broken Ranks / Bring It Down!
     1x Battle Tactic Token – Aggressive Expansion / Conquer
     1x Battle Tactic Token – Slay the Warlord / Monstrous Takeover
     1x Battle Tactic Token – Ferocious Advance / Savage Spearhead


—description from the publisher

Name: Anticamente: Wargame ad aree esagonali per il periodo antico
Description:
Anticamente ("In Ancient Times") allows you to play epic battles from antiquity to the early renaissance, using an aerial approach. 
The aerial approach will allow you to use the three-dimensional elements of the landscape in complete synergy with the rules.

–description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval
Description:
Hordes & Heroes Medieval is designed as a fast play tabletop historical wargame, which uses hexagon marked terrain as a precise and effective method for moving troops. The rule system is simple and easy to learn, yet sophisticated enough to allow “realistic“ battles to be fought between a diverse range of medieval armies. It is easy to play, but more difficult to master.

One A4 Quick Reference Sheet is sufficient to contain all the information necessary to play. The Combat Results Tables can be printed or photocopied, cut and pasted together as required. The main rules need only be consulted when players are learning the rules, and occasionally thereafter, to clarify situations as they arise.

The precision of the movement system and the speed and efficiency of the combat system ensure that the game flows quickly and even a closely fought contest between two armies of 150 points can be concluded within 1½ hours to 2 hours.

The game is designed to be played on modular hex terrain which can accommodate a range of different terrain features, e.g. open ground, hills and slopes, rivers, woods, impenetrable terrain etc. Larger terrain features can extend over a number of adjacent hexes. The terrain is an extremely important aspect of the rules, in that, it is of great strategical and tactical significance because of the way it influences movement, Command and Control, and combat.

—description from the publisher

Name: Train in Vain
Description:
A roll and write game of rails across various terrain where players try to connect Cities, buy and sell goods, and complete contracts. Players are responsible for upgrading their trains to be able to develop better abilities and make their travel easier and more profitable. The Conductor and Engineer lend a hand as well as the occasional Station that can be dropped on an empty hex of the map to complete those languishing routes.

Each turn a pair of dice are rolled. All players use the same dice to complete an action: place a track, hire Conductor and Engineer, work toward a train upgrade, buy or sell a Good.

Clever placement is the order of the day in this game, players will find themselves feeling like their trains are in vain on non-connected tracks until it all comes together and Contracts start flying off the board.

Train in Vain plays 1+ players, meaning any number of players could play as long as they have access to the dice.

—description from the designer

Name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval – Siege & Assault Supplement
Description:
Hordes & Heroes Medieval Siege & Assault Rules - Wargaming sieges and assaults have always proved challenging to wargamers.

Sieges were by their very nature often long drawn out affairs often lasting many weeks, months or even years. 
Once the preparations for the assault were complete and the attack was launched the fighting would be fast, furious and intense as attackers and defenders fought for supremacy. 
The Siege & Assault rules enable the Hordes & Heroes system to be used to conduct sieges and assaults against defended castles, towns and strongholds. They enable the use of a wide range of medieval siege equipment to be employed in breaching an array of different defences from simple earthworks to the massive stone walls of a major city. 
In conjunction with the core medieval rules they enable campaign scenarios to be constructed which enable gamers to explore the strategic as well as the tactical aspects of medieval warfare.

—description from the publisher

Name: Scrappet Kaiser Princess
Description:
Mindy has just turned 10 and her parents have finally allowed her to play the collectable card game she’s been obsessing over: Scrappet Kaiser. But with the annual tournament starting next week, her journey to become the best has hit warp speed! With her close circle of friends and a few bucks, can she build a collection good enough to compete with the champ?

In this solitaire worker-placement board game, you play as Mindy as she plans out how her friends run various errands throughout the week. However, plans will fall apart as unexpected Events ruin your day and reveal that your friends just aren’t that into Scrappet Kaiser! As your collection grows, don’t forget to keep that Ego in check, because your friends will also get tired of getting bossed around. After seven days, total up your final score and check your ranking in the rulebook. Help Mindy become the champ by getting an S Rank!

—description from the designer

Name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval – Army Lists
Description:
The HHM army lists are designed to enable any medieval historical army to be represented on the table top, in a miniature game, up to an agreed point value.

We have endeavoured to make the lists as flexible as the historical sources which were consulted would permit.

Hordes & Heroes Medieval Army Lists currently contain 28 different armies which can be easily modified and adapted to your own specific preferences or requirements, for use in a particular game, or to form part of an historical campaign.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Kamakura Period to Muromachi Period

Name: Mud Cakes
Description:
Mud Cakes is a tribute to childhood memories when our grandma took care of us in her home, and we played in the garden creating stories, imagining adventures, and even cooking mud cakes.

Some dirt and water are enough to get in a culinary mud challenge and create the most exquisite preparations to fulfill your client’s wishes. Clay, bugs, dry leaves, stones, grass, even snails may help you to delight you special guests: you granny, little brother, teddy bear, your dog, cat and Nina doll.

Get as many satisfaction points from the guests by having fun in the mud and cooking the most suited mud cakes.

What’s the order?

----español

Mud Cakes, es un bello homenaje a los recuerdos de la infancia, cuando la abuela nos cuidaba en su casa y nos divertíamos en su jardín creando historias, imaginando aventuras e incluso cocinando pasteles de  lodo.

Un poco de tierra y agua es suficiente para eludirnos en un desafío culinario y preparar los postres más exquisitos para satisfacer las preferencias del público. Arcilla, bichos, hojas secas, rocas, pasto y hasta caracoles en el menú para deleitar a nuestros invitados especiales: Abuelita, hermanito, osito de peluche, cachorro, gatito y muñeca María.

Consigue la mayor cantidad de puntos de diversión de los invitados, jugando en el barro a preparar los pasteles de barro más adecuados. Lanza y selecciona  dados, enlódate eligiendo la ubicación de tus pasteles, para finalizar  registrando los pedidos de tus invitados; Al final del juego obtendrás puntos de diversión por la ubicación de tus pasteles y por tener los pasteles adecuados para cada pedido de los invitados.

¿Qué quiere ordenar?

Name: The Queen's Dilemma
Description:
The Queen's Dilemma is a sequel to The King's Dilemma,, the award-winning (and Kennerspiel des Jahres-nominated) interactive narrative legacy game, and uses an improved Dilemma Card System to bring players an even more immersive experience.

Set a hundred years after the dramatic events of the first game and building upon the revolutionary Dilemma Card System, The Queen’s Dilemma introduces a brand-new story, improves the existing legacy mechanisms, and adds a lot of new exclusive features.

Take your seat at the Queen’s Council and choose your own persona from a pool of 6 unique characters. You will live the story from their perspective, whether as a cunning master of subterfuge, a fierce military leader, a greedy merchant, a philosopher advocating for progress, an aristocrat with a penchant for the occult, or a vicious lord tied to criminal activities.

Develop your character with exclusive personal abilities. Each character comes with Duchies or Marks under their direct control, and a deck of secret personal objectives and branching narrative paths that will define your story and future goals—which may intertwine with the destiny of the entire kingdom.

Shape the political identity of the Realm through the new ideology system. The policies you enact will alter the balance between six opposing political ideologies: Tradition against Progress, Force against Diplomacy and Order against Liberty. These also represent the moral values and agenda of your character: each one has a founding ideology they always root for, and other secondary interests whose importance varies from game to game, changing alliances at the table.

But that’s not all. The new keyword system allows the game to keep track of your personal choices: an unexpected act of forgiveness could secure you the eternal gratitude of the people, but a radical resolution could tarnish your reputation forever. Make your decisions wisely: the consequences of your choices will come back to reward or haunt your character later in the campaign.

Watch the map of the kingdom evolve as a result of your decisions! The events that unfold will change the world forever and unlock new game rules altering the flow of the campaign. Defend your interests when a Dilemma card directly involves the territories placed under your control, and construct buildings to gain new abilities and sources of revenue.

Manage the resources of your lands and trade with other players to achieve your goals: increase your political power, collect materials to improve your buildings, support the Queen’s Army in the war in the south, and provide for the needs of your people to avoid discontent, unrest, and revolts.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wo war's?
Description:
16 large animal cards are laid out in a square, the small animal chips with the same images are also placed face up in the center, each tile must be exposed. Whoever's turn it is rolls the dice and moves the figure on the large cards accordingly, the animal on the card shows which small tile must be turned over. If the figure lands on an animal that is no longer visible, the player must try to find the matching small tile. If he succeeds, he gets a chip, whoever has 4 chips first wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Blumen-WO
Description:
A memory of 4 cards. The playing cards each contain 4 identical pictures. The cards are laid out face down and 4 cards are turned over by one player at a time. If two, three or four identical cards are revealed, you get to keep them.

—user summary

Name: Throwing Star
Description:
A two-card throwing game.

Players stand back to back, each with a throwing star in hand. They take three steps and at the count of three, they turn around and throw their star at their opponent.

The first player to land a hit wins. Wear eye protection. Hits to the head = Disqualification.

As someone who has some experience in throwing cards, the speed element of this can make things pretty wild. If you try to throw it too fast, it will NOT hit your target. If you wait too long, you will get hit.


This game was a stretch goal add-on for the Ninja: Silent But Deadly Kickstarter.

Delivered in the February 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Ping Pong Literario
Description:
A creative game to talk about books, literature and much more.
Ideal to play it at all times in homes, schools, libraries and desktops.

Three ways to play. The conversation is the protagonist and these cards know it. It is not a trivia game. We all have an answer for these letters.


Game modes

Ping Pong: A game to generate and share conversations about your reading journey.

InversaMente: Score points by guessing the other players' answers.

Tell me what you answer is... and I'll tell you what you read: To win you must discover the questions with the clues they give you.

The Winner is the one who reach the total points agreed upon at the start of the game or is winning after the session is over.

Name: Ping Pong Literario 2
Description:
A creative game to talk about books, literature and much more.
Ideal to play it at all times in homes, schools, libraries and desktops.

Three ways to play. The conversation is the protagonist and these cards know it. It is not a trivia game. We all have an answer for these letters.


Game modes

Ping Pong: A game to generate and share conversations about your reading journey.

InversaMente: Score points by guessing the other players' answers.

Tell me what you answer is... and I'll tell you what you read: To win you must discover the questions with the clues they give you.

True or false: The same question can have different answers, depending on whether the truth is told or not. Try to find out if the other players are lying and score a lot of points!

The Winner is the one who reach the total points agreed upon at the start of the game or is winning after the session is over.

Name: Casino: The Game of Gambling Strategy
Description:
Similar to Monopoly, players roll dice and move around the board, perform actions as listed on the squares they land on.  Some squares require the players to roll dice, play cards, or use a roulette wheel to gain or lose gambling chips.

Lose all your chips and you're out of the game.  The first player to collect a set or more of color-coded casinos and to 'cut and run' with their chips, wins.

Name: Escape Room: The Game – Nuclear Countdown
Description:
The beeping of the fax machine catches you off guard. It's a bomb threat, it says a bomb will go off tonight somewhere downtown. The fax was easy to trace, you and your team head out and 23 minutes later you knock on the door of one William Teller. No answer. The lock on the door is as poor as the building you're standing in and within seconds you're in the apartment. You see a table that is filled with all kinds of materials that send shivers down your spine. At that moment, your phone rings and your worst nightmare becomes reality, the bomb threat is real! William Teller has been arrested and was making a big scene, saying he wanted a window seat to watch the explosion at 8:00pm sharp. You realize that's in exactly one hour ...

Expansion puzzle to any Escape Room: The Game base game that contains the Chrono Decoder. This expansion was originally included in the 2016 Escape Room: The Game.
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Charms: Quests For Antiracism
Description:
Quests for Antiracism can expand CHARMS: A Game of Insight. Players ask questions, roll and interpret inspiring game pieces, and try to discover the most amazing insights toward antiracism. *Or the game's questions can be used for dialogue, reflection, or writing prompts on your own or with any size group. Includes options for online play!

—description from the publisher

Name: Turing
Description:
A pocket sized image interpretation limited communication game for 2-6 players.

The Turing test is a thought experiment.  An interrogator communicates with two test subjects, one is a computer, the other a human.  If once the interrogator is willing to make a determination they judge the computer to be a human it can be said to have exhibited true intelligence.  Which is all well and good for the computer, but what does that mean for that human?

Welcome to Turing.

Players take turns attempting to communicate their humanity via a series of abstract images against those selected by the game.  They select 1 card from between 2 and 4 (depending on difficulty level, the game randomly selects one another. They repeat this three times, then the other players try to figure out which of the sets of three cards were chosen by an intelligent being rather than randomly thrown out by the game. Successful identification allows both identifier and selector to score.  The round ends when one player has scored at least five points.

The player with the most points wins.

Name: Meine Burg Deine Burg
Description:
The players take turns placing wall stones in a square grid. The player who closes a castle with the last wall stone marks it with his own flag and must place another wall stone. Once all the wall stones have been placed, the player with the most castles wins.

—user summary

Name: Der Frosch sitzt schwitzend im Schaukelstuhl
Description:
Each player receives 5 cards with sentence parts (parts 1 to 4). Whoever's turn it is draws a new card from the deck and is allowed to lay out a complete set of parts 1 to 4. Funny sentences should be created by mixing the sentence parts. Whoever cannot lay out a sentence must pass. The winner is the player who was able to lay out all the cards in his hand first.

—user summary

Name: Diercke Entdecker Spiel
Description:
The game can be played on either a Germany, Europe or World map. Depending on the chosen map, the corresponding question/action cards are used. Each player receives an itinerary that specifies the areas in which master questions must be answered in order to be allowed to acquire them. In order to move with the game figure, questions must be answered, drawings made or pantomime performances guessed. acquired areas can also be lost again. With the use of coins, in addition to acquiring territories, it is also possible to travel by plane or ship, or to bring a second game figure into play. The first player to completely fulfil his travel plan wins the game.

—user summary

Name: The Highest Adventure: The 1953 British Mount Everest Expedition
Description:
Highest Adventure is a solitaire game of exploration set during the 1953 assault on Mount Everest. You will lead a team of seasoned climbers and attempt to be the first to summit the greatest peak on the globe. You will need to wisely equip your expedition with the supplies, choose your climbers and assault teams, map out your route, and then start up the mountain for death or glory.

This is a print-and-play game, with two main decks of cards, some tokens and a series of location cards. Before the game, players will need to carefully select supply cards to give them the best chance at success because the mountain is an unforgiving place that will throw dangerous Encounter Cards at the expedition. Once on their way up the mountain, how well the player balances these cards with the expedition's health, endurance, and strength will define the razor thin margin of success and failure atop Mount Everest.
 All components (and some alternatives) are provided in the PNP files. Expect your first expedition to take around 30min, with follow up games lasting around 15-20min. Mount Everest is a dangerous place, so carefully choose your supplies and read the rock face well, and you just might secure the coveted prize of being the first to reach the roof of the world.

—description from the designer

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Kharadron Overlords
Description:
The Kharadron are a civilisation of mercantile duardin who dwell in vast sky-ports amidst the clouds of the Mortal Realms. Guided by their Code and armed with powerful aethermatic weaponry, they are utterly committed to the pursuit of wealth.

Profit awaits in the Eightpoints – and with this set, you’ll be able to claim it! Designed to make kicking off or expanding a diverse warband of Kharadron Overlords simple, it also contains a number of accessories to help you in your games. What’s more, you’ll save money compared to getting the models inside separately!

This set contains:
– 3x Skywardens/Endrinriggers – airborne warriors with aethermatic weapons buildable as Skywardens or Endrinriggers
– 5x Grundstok Thunderers – ridiculously versatile ranged warriors with a vast array of guns available to them
– 2x token boards designed to help you track wounds, on-going effects, statuses and more
– Fighter and ability cards with the rules for your warband

Please note – you’ll need a copy of the Warcry Core Book to use this product.

This set is supplied in 149 components and comes with 10x 32mm round bases and 3x 35mm flying bases.

Name: Det dårlige selskab: udvidelse #3 – Ekstra sort!
Description:
A new expansion with 240 extra dark and inappropriate cards.

Includes 10 blank write-yourself cards, so you can include your own stupid cards and three types of bonus cards.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Året Der Gik! 2020
Description: A 2020-themed expansion for Det dårlige selskab, with footnotes on all cards explaining the puns and jokes. 140 cards and three blanks for adding own fun.

Name: Pulp Invasion X2
Description:
Sending down landing teams aids in your search for the Super Weapons to prevent the Cosmic Hegemony from their nefarious plans. Beware though of 3 new Vassal aliens who have joined the Hegemony to rule the galaxy.

The Pulp Invasion X2 expansion adds new exploration cards, new captains, a new crew die, and a helpful landing team.

For this expansion there are 2 new Captain cards that use the new Landing Crew die, 3 new Alien Vassals that affect game play while in the various Hegemony sectors. 2 new Planets to explore and 2 additional Super Weapons with new actions.

Additionally there are 8 new exploration cards, which change game replay-ability since you only deal a subset during the game. Most have beneficial actions and allow for greater player strategy.

Name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval Fantasy
Description:
Hordes & Heroes Medieval Fantasy rule system is based on H&H Medieval with the addition of magic and special rules to reflect the particular fighting characteristics associated with particular fantasy armies.

It is designed as a fast play tabletop wargame, which uses hexagon marked terrain as a precise and effective method for moving troops. 
The rule system is simple and easy to learn, yet sophisticated enough to allow “realistic“ battles to be fought between a diverse range of fantasy armies. 
It is easy to play, but more difficult to master.

One A4 Quick Reference Sheet is sufficient to contain all the information necessary to play. The Combat Results Tables can be printed or photocopied, cut and pasted together as required. There is a Quick Reference Sheet Generator on the website to enable players to quickly create and print the play sheet for a game between any fantasy armies contained in the army lists. The main rules need only be consulted when players are learning the rules, and occasionally thereafter, to clarify situations as they arise.

The precision of the movement system and the speed and efficiency of the combat system ensure that the game flows quickly and even a closely fought contest between two armies of 150 points can be concluded within 1½ hours to 2 hours. This makes the system ideally suited for competitive and tournament play.

The game is designed to be played on modular hex terrain which can accommodate a range of different terrain features, e.g. open ground, hills and slopes, rivers, woods, impenetrable terrain etc.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval Fantasy – Army Lists
Description:
The HHM Fantasy Army Lists are designed to enable any medieval fantasy army to be represented on the table top, in a miniature game, up to an agreed point value.

We have endeavored to make the lists as flexible as possible to enable historical armies to be used with the addition of fantasy elements, such as flying units and magicians.

Hordes & Heroes Medieval Fantasy Army Lists currently contain 24 different armies which can be easily modified and adapted to your own specific preferences or requirements, for use in a particular game, or to form part of a fantasy campaign.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Kamakura Period to Muromachi Period

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Card Up Your Sleeve
Description:
This was the promotional card for Gen Con 2019. It is a Prize card for ante during gambling, saying: "The next time you ante, add this card to the Prize Bin, then draw 3 cards from your Character Deck."

On the back side of the card is instructions for a Prize Variant, to "sweeten the pot during a Round of Gambling."

Name: Grim Fantasy
Description:
The game of Grim Fantasy is a fantasy skirmish wargame between two or more players, with games of up to four players working quite well. The game is set in a dark fairy-tale world that is inspired by European lore as transported to colonies in a New World.

Quick synopsis:
Set in the Village of Armbraid, the Pilgrims that have come from the Old Word are discovering that their new home is not as safe as they thought it would be. Creatures from the Great Woods raid their small village, wreaking havoc when they come.

Nearby the Natives are friendly, but wary. Some say that they know the land and what it can do.

The land appears to be strange and changes both people and objects, some say that even the Scarecrows move around at night...

—description from the publisher

Name: Hunt a Killer: Hawthorn Junction
Description:
A string of disappearances in the blue-collar town of Hawthorn Junction has gone overlooked. As the town’s newest resident, you will have to decide who to trust. Everyone is a suspect. Can you uncover the mystery and restore peace to this quaint, rural town?

In this all-in-one box, you’ll receive a “welcome package” that holds the keys to solving the string of disappearances that have plagued Hawthorn Junction. It's 3-6 hours of gameplay.

—description from publisher

Name: Devenez Chef: Apéro en folie
Description:
Devenez Chef: Apéro en folie
Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level
Main ingredients: asparagus, coppa, avocado 
Other ingredients: Greek and Bulgarian yogurt, goat cheese, sundried tomatoes, breadsticks, Espelette pepper, lemon, shrimp, basil and cucumber

Gameplay

     Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors 
     Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players 
     Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list 
     Gather your material with the supplied material list 
     Cook step by step and enjoy your chef's menu:


While cooking, spice up your game and try to earn stars by taking up challenges, by answering quizzes or riddles slipped into your game.

Once all the missions have been completed, have a good time while tasting your menu together.

Winning conditions:
The winner is the player or team who scored the most "stars"

Each box contains numbered "Mission" cards, 1 shopping list, 1 equipment list, the rules of the game and its scoreboard.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Gymnastics Gold
Description:
Gymnastics Gold is a dice manipulation and card game designed to simulate a high-level gymnastics meet. Players will rotate between Uneven Bars, Balance Beam, Floor Exercise and Vault, drawing cards and choosing which skills they will try to execute. Harder skills yield greater rewards but also carry harsher deductions.

Each event has unique dice mechanisms representing the gymnast's execution of her skills. Players must decide whether to keep rolling (chasing glory at the risk of more deductions) or to take their lumps and call it quits. Smart decisions--and getting an adrenaline boost at the right time--will ultimately make the difference between a gold medal and not even making the podium.

When the meet is over, awards are given to the top-scoring gymnast in each event, with one gymnast being crowned as All Around Champion.

Name: That's so 80s
Description: Re-live the era of the Mullet haircut, extreme shoulder pads and the Dukes of Hazzard TV show with this That's So 80s Quiz from Ridley's Games. Containing 200 quiz cards, there are 1000 questions to test even the most knowledgeable 1980s expert!

Name: Fly Home!
Description:
Night falls, and the birds are still a long way from their nests! Young bird watchers join forces to help them find their natural habitats in good time because soon the owls will wake up!

Fly Home! is a co-operative game that combines observation and memory with a dose of chance. Turn the cards over and look for the common characteristics of the birds: networked legs or claws, white or orange plumage, migrating or sedentary — everyone has something in common with their neighbors! Can you remember the exact location of the birds? Or are you taking risks by looking for other birds? Binoculars can help, but be careful as the owls are ready to go...

Name: Dice Trip: France
Description: Dice Trip: France is most likely akin to Dice Trip: Switzerland, but with a few twists.

Name: Dice Trip: Belgium
Description: Dice Trip: Belgium is most likely akin to Dice Trip: Switzerland, but with a few twists.

Name: Record Deal
Description:
User Review

The object is to impress the other players with your singing performance when given a random set of lyrics and a random genre of music.

Each player is given two song cards, each with a set of lyrics, and spins the spinner for a random genre. (A player may spin for another genre by using one’s only Fire the Band Token.) After given some time to prepare, the player performs the chosen song in the assigned genre. (The publisher provides a web site where the assigned background music can be used.) After everyone has performed, each player has two votes to cast for the best performance(s). The player with the most votes get a Record Deal. Scoring two Record Deals wins the game.

Name: Helionox: Sunward Struggle
Description:
Fan made - cards-only remix of ideas in the Helionox universe.  Designed to be a travel, and condensed, version that is both familiar and stand on its own.

Travel from planet to planet in this solo deckbuilder overcoming Events, ferrying cargo to fulfill Requests, and trying to score higher than the always lurking Shadow Syndicate.

This is a fan-made standalone game created with the copyright holder's permission. Players play and buy cards, move their ship, and overcome events on their turn.

Game ends after 9 rounds when the event deck runs out.

Name: Escape Room: The Game – Exp 1
Description:
It is a three in one expansion pack for Escape Room the Game.
This expansion pack includes 3 stand alone games: Murder Mystery, FunLand, and a new adventure:  Temple of the Aztec.

For each expansion, there are 3 parts. Players need to find the keys to proceed to the next levels. You have 60 minutes, start NOW!
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Tekhenu: Time of Seth
Description:
With the power and splendor of Egypt increasing, its influence now reaches far beyond its borders. Seth, the god of conflict, demands that you subdue Canaan, and wage war on the mighty Hittite Empire. Your soldiers are to march on any land that dares defy you or pose a threat to your kingdom. It is the time to muster your armies, gather your priests, claim mighty artifacts and secure the favor of a powerful cult to pave your way into even greater victories.

Tekhenu: Time of Seth adds new layers of interaction and new options to Tekhenu: Obelisk of the Sun. A new board opens up options of conquering neighboring lands to receive in-game benefits, as well as new scoring opportunities. New dice allow for mustering Soldiers and gathering priests. However, conquest comes with a price, as with more battles fought, balancing one's deeds becomes more complicated than before.

Apart from soldiers needed to take control of lands beyond the borders of Egypt, players also gather priests that allow them to take control of artifacts. These new cards offer new and nuanced ways of planning turns, combining strategic plays and scoring victory points.

The expansion also contains advanced rules specifically designed to enhance the 2–player experience.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Tekhenu – Obelisk of the Sun

Name: Monkey Tree
Description:
Remove the sticks from the tree, be careful not to disturb the monkeys!

On their turn a player will roll the die and then pull out the corresponding coloured stick. If the monkeys fall they collect them.

The game ends when all the sticks have been removed.

The player with the least amount of monkeys wins!

Name: Death of the Goblin King: A solo dungeon crawl
Description:
Death of the Goblin King: A solo dungeon crawl is a solitaire dungeon crawl where you explore a dungeon with monsters, traps, doors and secret passages.  Travers the 5 levels of the dungeon, find the keys to unlock each level door, and destroy any monsters in your way until you reach the final Big Boss – The Goblin King and destroy him.   You only need two decks of regular poker sized cards.  No dice, pen or paper is needs, just 2 decks of cards and this rulebook.

Death of the Goblin King: A solo dungeon crawl is played in turns with you as the adventurer exploring the darkest depths of a sinister dungeon.  Each turn you'll be exploring the dungeon by moving your character card “Ace of Clubs” from card to card.   As you turn over each unexplored card you may encounter monsters, a trap, treasures, a key, a door, a secret passage or helpful items.  As you unlock the door to the next level you must defeat the boss of that level until you reach the final 5th level and the ultimate boss The Goblin King.  Defeat him and you win the game.   You can only explore chambers “cards” that are either vertical or horizontal to your character card.  To explore the chamber, you place your character card underneath the chamber card and flip over the card to see what awaits you.

VICTORY CONDITIONS
On each level you must defeat the boss of that level until you reach the final 5th level and the ultimate boss The Goblin King.  Defeat The Goblin King and you win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Teotihuacan: Expert Challenges – Book 2
Description:
Teotihuacan: Expert Challenges is a series of setups intended to challenge players who are well familiar with the game.

Book 2 contains two challenges.

Decoration Challenge
This is a challenge for players who have at least some experience playing the base game. It focuses on decorating the temple as it is being built.

Pyramid Challenge
This is a challenge for players who have at least some experience playing the base game. The Action Boards are set up so that players can easily build the Pyramid, and the game end is likely to be triggered early due to the finishing of the Pyramid.

—description from the publisher

Name: Resident Evil 3: The Board Game – The Last Escape
Description: The Last Escape expansion upgrades your RE3: TBG campaign with several new gameplay elements including new characters, enemies, narrative event cards, scenarios, campaign rules, and alternate game modes.

Name: VILA
Description:
In VILA, players (red and green) represent tribal chiefs who manage their bushmen to explore their surroundings, avoiding traps, fishing, and gathering food when possible. Players take alternative turns to lay out their cards to build a joint map.

Each player has a different scoring condition, hidden from the other player, and each scoring condition awards both players so pay attention to your opponent’s moves. The player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Teabbles: that bubble tea game
Description:
Teabbles is a card game where you get to have a different kind of fun with the most-loved beverage – boba! Assume the role of a boba store owner and make drinks by having all the ingredients each drink requires. Use action cards to boost the gameplay with various functions like stealing someone’s drink, scope out the competition, replenishing your inventory, and more! There are 3 gameplay variants in one set: Original Play, Bluff, and Boba the Builder. Choose a variant to suit your cravings, just like your boba orders!

In Original Play, match the ingredients to the ones shown on the drink card to fulfil drink orders, then draw reward cards after you’ve completed them. Deftly dodge your competitors’ sabotage tactics, and be the first to earn 11 points worth of drinks.

In Bluff, think of it as Original Play, with a twist! Inspired by a wrong order, how do you know if the ingredients used to make a drink are correct? No one knows until someone gets called out. Will the temptation of a yummy reward risk a game of lies and a ruined reputation? The first to complete 5 drinks will end the game, but the one with the highest points will win.

In Boba the Builder, manage and build your inventory to fulfil the market demand for boba! Peek over at your competitors and anticipate the drinks they plan to make. Put a stop to their plan, or make calculated moves to snatch up all the drinks when everyone’s least expecting it!

—description from the designer

Name: Drinking War
Description:
Aim of the game


     To win Drinking War, you must be the player at the end of the game with the most Health Points (HP).
     Your objective is to attack your opponents by giving them sips from the various cards.
     When you receive sips you have the choice of drinking them or not drinking them by losing one Health Point.


The game includes 3 different game modes (packs). The difficulty and strategy increases from Pack 1 to Pack 3.
It is also possible to play without drinking.

The Great Return

In Ancient Rome, the taverns appearance changed the way of life of social classes, following a game called DRINKING WAR, which quickly became popular. Farmers, Knights, nobles, everyone played it to settle their accounts with the help of this strategic drinking game! However, the craze of this game revealed a previously unknown disease "the Hangover" in the year 17 AD.
A year later, an exceptional Summit held by the YouDrankAll Emperor banned the game for 2000 years by isolating the rules in the depths of the Vatican cellar.
Today, it returns after an eternal expectation to revolutionize our parties!

—description from the designer

Name: Das große Bielefeld-Spiel
Description:
Players move their figure over a map of Bielefeld by rolling the dice and must visit 5 randomly drawn landmarks. On the way lurk event fields (sit out once, move forward, jump to a certain place). Once you have visited your 5 destinations, you still have to reach the final destination. The winner is the one who manages to do this first.

—user summary

Name: Random Battle
Description:
Choose to play as one of six characters: Bear, Wizard, Vampire, Ninja, Robot, Pterodactyl.
Take turns to either build up your hand, or attack opponents using the cards you already hold.
Six types of Attack Card correspond to six attack zones on the body. Combo Cards add to the Attack Score, Counter Cards add to the Defence Score.
Roll dice to determine if an attack is successful or not.
Win by surviving the final round with the least amount of damage.
Nerve, cunning, and a large slice of luck are required to be a Random Battle champion.
Two six-sided dice are required (NOT included).

—description from the designer

Name: The Catholic Card Game: Consecrated Expansion
Description:
54 card expansion filled with cards written ONLY by nuns and priests!

Cards written by:


     The Clergy of Ascension: Fr. Mark-Mary Ames, CFR, Fr. Josh Johnson, Fr. Mike Schmitz, Fr. Mark Toups
     Catholic Stuff You Should Know
     The Sisters of CJC
     Fr. Paul from Conception Abbey
     Fr. Tim Nelligan


—description from the publisher

Name: The Catholic Card Game: NFP Expansion
Description:
A 54 card expansion made in collaboration with Simcha Fisher!

This expansion pack is recommended for adults only. Being all about Natural Family Planning, the cards in this deck were written for adults who enjoy marital intimacy jokes and the wonders and headaches of NFP :)

—description from the publisher

Name: Wer's weiß gewinnt!
Description:
A quiz game with 600 questions, 5 each on 120 cards. The questions are numbered. Who knows the answer gets the number of the question credited as points, if you do not know the value is deducted. The first to reach an agreed amount of points wins.

—user summary

Name: Mit Winnetou im Wilden Westen
Description:
A quiz game about the Wild West with 600 questions. The questions are divided into 3 levels of difficulty. The player whose turn it is chooses a difficulty level (1/2/3) and is asked a corresponding question. If you answer correctly you get 1/2/3 points, otherwise they are deducted from the previous score. The first to reach an agreed number of points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: auto+reise
Description:
Players travel on vacation in their car and can use 3 different routes to do so, the highway, the state road or the country road. Different maximum speeds apply on the routes: 6 / 5 / 4 dice points can be used as a maximum. In addition, there are different event fields for each route. The player who arrives first at the vacation destination and has not forgotten his fuel and rest break wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Bone Scorpions XL-Sized Alternate Enemy Duo Pack
Description:
Though the massively mutated Dark Stone Scorpions are renowned for their thick shells, potent poison, and razor-edged claws that can snap a man in two with a single powerful pinch, the nightmarish Bone Scorpions that roam the alien desert dunes of the Blasted Wastes and the shadowy groves within the Forest of the Dead are perhaps more terrifying. Equal in size and ferocity with their earthly counterparts, the Bone Scorpions are more agile and quick to enrage, lashing out with the lightning-fast retaliatory strikes of their stinging tails at any that draw too near.

This Alternate Enemy Pack converts the terrifying and poisonous Dark Stone Scorpions into the nightmarish Bone Scorpions for use in the Blasted Wastes and Forest of the Dead OtherWorlds! There are 2 XL Dark Stone Scorpion models included to paint in this alternate color scheme, 1 Blasted Wastes Artifact card, and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle of Legends: Rome vs Macedon
Description:
Battle of Legends: Rome vs Macedon: Print & Play Edition, which is a reimplementation of Battle of Legends: Print & Play Edition (2019 Wargame Print & Play Contest Winner), is a two-player board game that focuses on four battles fought between Roman Republic and Macedonian Kingdom in the 3rd and 2nd centuries BC, namely Elis (208 BC), Aous (198 BC), Cynoscephalae (197 BC), and Pydna (168 BC). It is developed to simulate those battles on a tactical level with a hex grid board, terrain tiles, unit counters, faction cards, and d6 dice.

The game board is divided into hex spaces for unit placement and terrain tiles are placed onto them to create the battlefield of a chosen scenario. The Hill, River, and Forest are the terrain types which affects unit movement and combat in different ways. For instance, in battle Cynoscephalae (197 BC), which is mainly a hill battle, one hit is ignored if a unit on ground is attacking against a target unit on hill, in order to reflect the difficulty of uphill combat.
 A unit is represented by a number of counters (equal to unit strength) on a hex space. The Roman army consists of Principe, Triarii, Velites, Elephants, and Equites units; whereas the Macedon army contains Pezhetairoi, Hypaspists, Peltasts, Hetairoi, and Cretans units, each having its own movement-attack-defense powers, special skills and abilities. Great effort has been made to bring out the differences in fighting formations of two armies, “Legion” vs “Phalanx”, while preserving a simple and streamlined game mechanism.

A leader is attached onto a unit and moves with it while upgrading friendly units in range. Leader influenced units make more powerful attacks, and hold the ground better. Therefore, effective positioning of a leader allows you to take the advantage in the course of battle. 
 Faction cards lie at the heart of the game. They are kept secret and played to order units (green), activate their offensive (red)-defensive (blue) abilities, or start an event. Each faction has its own unique set and the content is changing from one scenario to another. Order cards allow you to position your units strategically across the battlefield to best coordinate your attacks, while ability & event cards empower you to apply some combat tactics such as charging, flanking, envelopment, phalanx, testudo, and withdraw. There is also a scenario card in each deck which takes the place of a key event happened in that battle. For example, the surprising pass of Romans through a secret path in Aous Battle (198 BC) is simulated by an order card which upgrades their movement up to 5 hexes.

BoL is played over a number of game rounds (scenario specific) in which players take their turns respectively. Each turn consists of three steps:
1.Order Units: Order a group of units by playing an order card from your hand.
2.Move Units: Move each of ordered units either by marching, or attacking. Play an ability, or event card where possible.
3.Select Cards: Manage your hand by discarding-taking cards from your faction deck.
This ordering of steps imposes a strategic depth to the gameplay by forcing you foresee upcoming events and make necessary adjustments beforehand.

The dice combat system is kept simple yet efficient, in which engagements are resolved quickly by referencing unit cards. To succeed in combat, you must consider unit types, unit strength, ranges, terrain effects and leadership.

To win the game, you must bring your opponent down to zero morale, or stand higher on morale at the end of the last round. Morale status may be changed with losses of units, or strategic places on board.

—description from the designer

Name: The Reward
Description:
Participate in the biggest auction of all time and collect the most money and other assets to win the game! Make your wildest dreams come true by getting the coveted goods that everyone wants!

The Reward is a game for 3 to 6 players and is intended for players 8 years and older.

At the start of the game, each player chooses a residence, a car and another asset, either a curiosity or a work of art. The time of the game is then determined by the players and added to the timer.

Throughout the game, events will be triggered, allowing players to acquire new goods and expand their collection.

Each player must accumulate the most winnings in dollars and other goods.

The game ends when the game time runs out or when all the real estate is gone. The player who finishes with the most money wins the game!

Name: Peanut Club: A dedication from Lord Henry Mac Fly promo card
Description:
A promo card for Peanut Club, Distributed at the Cannes International Game Festival (FIJ) in 2019.

It's a place reserved for an autograph or a drawing by the illustrator/creator of the game.

This card is played as the other cards. It is worth a luxury object and an antique object.

Name: ZERO
Description:
Young and old are there at ZERO. They all put a card face down on the table. Which card values are hidden? Add up quickly: three, five, seven. Minus one equals six. Who guessed the correct amount?

—description from the back cover

Name: STAR MARS
Description:
STAR MARS is a trick-taking game that was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (ã‚‹ã‚Šã‚‹ã‚Šã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ã‚º) 2020 box of trick-taking games, titled ãƒˆãƒªãƒ†ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ vol. 6 (Trick Taking Set vol. 6).

It is lightly themed as a familiar epic space opera, with one suit as the "rebels" and another as the "Mars" army; there are also 4 cards depicting a neutral ship, a Mars Kaiser card, a Princess Liza card, and a card roughly translated as Loose Landrunner.

The score board includes places for both the scores of the individual players, as well as a track for if the rebels or Mars has won more tricks.

Players earn points through "theme cards" that are chosen at the start of a hand.  These represent predictions the players are making, as to if Princess Liza will be won by the Mars side, or if the Mars Kaiser will defeat Loose Landrunner.

The first player to 13 points is the winner.

Name: Deen Challenge
Description:
Deen Challenge is an atmosphere game for fun games with families or friends !

500 questions and challenges will put your knowledge and talent to the test:

     Quiz
     Mime
     Drawing
     Words to guess


The games are linked without respite, for a super friendly atmosphere!

Win: The first player (or team) to collect 10 tokens wins the game!

–Translated description from the publisher

Name: Fist Fight: The Card Game
Description:
Fist Fight: The Card Game is a fast-paced, 1-on-1 card game based off of the action of old-school arcade fighting cabinets.

Two players simultaneously lay down cards from their hands and try to reduce their opponents hit points to 0. First person to do so wins the round, first to win 2 rounds wins the game. Rounds should last around 60 seconds.

There are attack, block, throw, and counter cards, all of which need to be played strategically to maximize the damage a player can do to their opponent, without taking too much damage of their own.

Predicting what your opponent might play and making a decision on what to do within seconds adds an arcade feel to the game; there isn't always time to think things over, sometimes you just have to throw down a card and hope it works, we call that our version of button mashing.

Whether played with a single opponent, or against a group of people rotating in and out, Fist Fight will provide hours of the high-energy entertainment.

Name: Naked Court: The Card Game
Description:
Naked Court: The Card Game is a fast moving, family friendly, hilarious, and strategic mix of solitaire, strip poker, and something else magnificently bizarre!

Players must first assemble their Courts during "The Royal Entrance", then attempt to stay clothed as your opponents do their darndest to denude your Royals in "The Battle Royale"; because in Naked Court...when you're NAKED, you're OUT.

On your turn, play up to 3 moves. There are a variety of move-types. Your goal is to denude all opposing Courts of 4 Royals. When your opponents Royals are naked, you win!

Name: Alebrijes
Description:
Three types of characters: lizards, insects and fish will give life to a multitude of fantastic animals. The mission is to find a way to create three different trios with the cards that are available.

Cleverly choosing, combining, stealing and trading will be the strategy necessary to win. Also be attentive to the game of the other participants, to make the best decisions. In addition, the "action cards" will dictate certain moves that must be used wisely.

Trios are built by combining TAIL + BODY + HEAD of the same type. The types are lizards, fish, and insects, each on a different background color to facilitate association.

The deck is mixed very well with the 70 cards (the image cards and the action cards). The mixed deck is placed in the center of the table upside down. Each player starts with 4 cards.

Each one will make the possible trios and will leave the remaining cards in their sector of the table to continue playing with them. All cards in play are placed face up, showing the built trios and the remaining cards.

In turn, each player will pick up a card from the deck: If an image card comes out, the following two movements are made:
1- The card is used to make a trio or laid in the player's sector of the table to use it later and Exchange is made (mandatory). For this, an image card of one of the playmates is chosen and it is exchanged for an own image card (the one that has just been lifted or another). You cannot break a trio already built by another player. If an action card is drawn, only the action specified on it is done and the exchange is not made.
Whenever one of these cards appears, it is played immediately.

The game ends when a player manages to assemble three different trios, that is, a trio of each type.

Name: I love El Paso
Description: A real estate trading game.  This is essentially like Monopoly with El Paso companies and locations.  The proceeeds to benefit eliminating racism, empowering women and YWCA El Paso Del Norte Region.  The six tokens are sombrero, tsco, chili pepper, trolley, UTEP logo, and cowboy boot.

Name: Dune: Imperium – Rise of Ix
Description:
Conflict spreads across the Imperium in Dune: Imperium – Rise of Ix, the first expansion to the award-winning board game.


     Enter the fray as one of three new Great Houses with unique leader abilities.
     Acquire technological innovations from the planet Ix for a lasting strategic advantage.
     Deploy fearsome dreadnoughts to rule the skies above Arrakis.
     Dispatch subtle infiltrators to outmaneuver your opponents.
     Dominate the Imperium in the new Epic game mode for a more intense, high-stakes challenge.
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Sitz Krieg ohne Hass: Orders of Battle – Operation Barbarossa 1941
Description:
Orders of Battle for German, Russian, Hungarian, Italian and Romanian forces during the Barbarossa campaign in 1941 to accompany the SKOH rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: 栄！(Sakae!)
Description:
The economic game æ „!, roughly translated as "Prosperity", puts the players in the world of Shibusawa Eiichi, a Japanese entrepreneur known as the father of Japanese capitalism, who established more than 500 companies.

Through three stages, the players take turns choosing certain actions, such as establishing an enterprise; training talent; borrowing; or market development.  After each player has taken a turn, a settlement phase will typically reward those players who've started the most valuable companies, but market conditions could alter the situation.

Once a player has reached a certain number of points the end of the game is triggered, and the player with the most points wins.

Name: Dinosaur World: Recruiter Promo Card
Description: With all the different types of workers employed at the park, a Recruiter is an absolute necessity. At any time, once per game, you may exchange up to 2 of your workers for workers of any color. Gain 7 VP at the end of the game if you did not use the Recruiter's ability.

Name: Colossus Fall
Description:
Me’garodo–the colossal living fortress that the Ancients built. For centuries it lay dormant; until now. For reasons unknown, Me’garodo has re-awakened, lumbering across the land, razing and flattening anything in its destructive path. Now, it's heading toward your village.

You and your fellow Rangers must defeat this gigantic, looming threat by destroying the Life-Gems that operate the Colossus, thus putting Me’garodo back to sleep. Best of luck, Rangers. The fate of your village is in your hands!

Colossus Fall is a cooperative game that could be played in several ways (depended on number of players). The Rangers’ goal is to use their limited actions cooperatively to try and break the three Life-Gems that appear on various parts of the Colossus, while avoiding being crushed by it in the process. A player could also play as the Colossus, trying to bash away all those pesky humans that are trying to put you back to sleep.

—description from the designer

Name: Ярость Эльфов
Description:
The board game Ð¯Ñ€Ð¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ð­Ð»ÑŒÑ„Ð¾Ð² ("Rage of the Elves") will allow you to take command of one of the elven armies and come together in a deadly duel with other players for world domination. Capture lands, hire the best warriors, and collect the strongest combination of cards to attack and defend your lands. Follow your tactical goal and complete it before other players win. Subdue the ancient dragon and direct his anger against anyone who gets in your way!

It's time to unleash all the rage of the Elven tribes!

Players must start the game at the corners of the map. you need to capture the fortresses of neutral creatures or attack the fortresses of other players. There is also a fortress in the center of the map, which is guarded by a dragon, capturing which the player can get more power. winning the game depends on the goals that the players take at the beginning of the game, they are different. in the battle, you need to layout 2 cards from your deck, then open them. the cards are placed cross by cross. the attack is described on the left side of the map in three directions. that is, the card can attack the enemy's card on the left, or on the right, or directly. in addition to the attack, there may be an attack defense, support for an ally, a double blow, a punchy blow, and so on. victory in battle is achieved by destroying all enemy units.

Name: Holgi's Ventil-Spiel
Description:
Self-published game by Galerie Club N. 68 in Kiel (a famous pub).

Two players move their six valves, which serve as game pieces, by dice roll over a 6x10 square playing area. The goal is to move his valves to the starting squares of the opponent.

At the start of the game, event cards are placed face down on 12 center squares, which take effect when entered. Opposing pieces can be captured and sent back to their starting squares.

—user summary

Name: Die ganze Welt der Ritter: Ritterturnier
Description:
The game Ritterturnier ("Knights Tournament") is part of the box Die ganze Welt der Ritter ("The whole world of knights"), which also contains other game elements (puzzle, craft sheet, etc.).

In the knight tournament will take part 4 knight figures. In one session a player is assigned 2 figures face down, at least one of which should survive the tournament. The knights move on a 6x6 playing field. Each player can move any knight. If 2 knights are on adjacent squares, they duel by dice roll. Only one knight survives the duel. A total of as many sessions are played as there are players participating, so that each player receives the assigned pieces once.

—user summary

Name: Luzi Luftig
Description:
Four airports are placed in the room, with the numbers 1 to 4 and a base. Parcels are placed on the airports, which are collected by the children and flown to the base with the plastic airplane "Luzi". The dice in the plane indicates the destination and when landed, the number of parcels to be loaded. The player who has brought the most parcels to the base after 2 rounds wins the game.
By the way: the airplane is powered by a battery, which makes the airplane wriggling and rattling.

—user summary

Name: The Front Line: Trench Warfare R&W
Description:
WARGAMEVAULT: https://www.wargamevault.com/product/374597/THE-FRONT-LINE-Trench-Warfare-RW

Solo war game in roll and write mode.
OBJECTIVE: The player must lower the enemy's morale to 0 to obtain victory, while your enemy will try to cross the second defensive line or will also try to lower the player's morale to win.

What does it take to play?

Just the printed sheet (it is recommended that the sheet be with a polypropylene protector)
      Several dice D6.
      An erasable marker.

TO FIGHT!!

—description from the designer

Name: Das Klosterspiel
Description:
The players want to recover the monastery treasure hidden in a crypt. There up to four monks who want to save the treasure compete with up to four commissioners who want to seize the treasure. Each player receives a piece, which he moves through the monastery by rolling the dice along predefined paths. To get into the crypt, 2 keys must first be obtained from the abbot or from opposing players. If you meet an opponent, you can get him drunk with a jug of wine and steal a key from him. There are other events (playing fields and temptation cards) that influence the course of the game. Whoever reaches the treasure field in the crypt first is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Deadlands: Shootout at High Noon
Description:
What're You Lookin' At?
Yer lookin' at the game that InQuest called the Best Game of '98: Deadlands! Walk the dusty streets of Gomorra, California, meet spell-slinging hucksters in the Green Eye Saloon, face deadly undead gunslingers in the town square, and stalk horrid monsters with Sioux shamans.

This introductory set includes easy-to-learn rules and trading cards exclusive to this package. Now there ain't no more excuse:
Larn to Play!

Law Dogs
They may not be much to look at, and a few of them ain't much to smell, neither, but the Law Dogs stand between the common townfolk and the evil things-human and critter alike-what stalk the streets of Gomorra, California. Now Nate Hunter and his posse have come to bring justice to Black Jack and his gang, accused of murdering the former sheriff. They'll git 'em, dead or alive.

Blackjacks
Led by a dude called "Black Jack," this gang of desperadoes has been raisin' a ruckus for as long as Gomorra's been around. While their leader Jackson's been accused of a lot of thangs, he only fesses up to takin' a chunk outta Sweetrock Mining, a powerful company what done jumped his claim. Yeah, so mebbe a few o' his boys're a little irksome, but Jack's a popular dude among the miners.

Name: Batalla a les illes Formigues
Description:
Batalla a les illes Formigues (Battle in the Formigues Islands) is a small and simple postcard game published as a freebie by SNAFU Design. It’s a 2-player game recreating three Middle-Ages naval battles that took place during the Crusade against the Crown of Aragon in 1285: 1st battle of Formigues Islands, 2nd battle of Formigues Islands, and Battle of Roses

One player controls the Catalan fleet, the other one, the Franco-Genovese fleet. Players alternate activations of one of their own squadrons (1 squadron = 1 counter), organized in one or more flotillas. In each activation a squadron can do just one action: move, veer or fight. When a flotilla has lost more than half its original strength it must begin a retreat movement and the game ends when a player has not any units on the map; then, VPs are tallied.

—description from the designer

Name: Wild Assent: Kickstarter Stretch Goals box
Description:
Inside this very box is a bounty of stretch goals unlocked during the Wild Assent Kickstarter campaign. It includes two miniatures suggested and voted on by fans, two crossovers, and one very lazy squire. The Wilds is a richer and more dangerous place thanks to you, the backers, and late pledgers, who made not just this box but Wild Assent itself possible. So, pat yourself on the back, pick your favourite Assent or Seeker, and we'll see you in the Wilds!

—description from the publisher

Name: Psycho Killer: Bloody Mary
Description:
Bloody Mary is the drinking game expansion to Psycho Killer. There are drinking cards and character cards, plus blank cards so you can add in your own rules. Bloody Mary is the perfect addition to any game night, pre-drinks or party! Grab a drink and strap yourself in for a drinking game that is new and exciting while keeping the nostalgia of your favourite drinking games!

—description from the publisher

Name: Quran Explorer Game
Description:
The Quran Explorer Game is a game based on the Quran. 
It is suitable for 2 to 6 players’ aged eight and above. 
It is a highly entertaining knowledge game to play with family and friends.

In this simple and fast-paced game of question and answer you have to give the correct answers, face the challenges, move forward, collect the Quran Cards, and land on the final intersection square that leads up to the Blessed Road and then reach to the finish before your friends reach there.
Along the way, as you earn points, you also learn a lot about the Quran and its teachings.
This game is truly a journey into the world of fun, wisdom and education for the entire family.

– Description from the publisher

Name: Boruto: Naruto Next Generations – The Board Game
Description:
Boruto: Naruto Next Generations - The Board Game is a cooperative game of ninja action for 1-4 players designed by Mitch Schroeder and Jeff Fraser. Based on the hit anime, Boruto: Naruto Next Generations - The Board Game sees players working together to protect the village of Konoha from dangerous villains attempting to destroy it.

Each player chooses a duo of one next-generation ninja student (such as Boruto, Sarada, or Mitsuki) and one adult ninja mentor (such as Naruto, Sasuke, or Sakura), combining their unique cards together to form their player deck. Each combination will result in different synergies and tactics, providing a new experience each time you play!

On their turn, players each play 2 cards from their hand to perform actions such as moving, attacking, and triggering special abilities. Each card played this way is added to the team's chakra pool, allowing other players to spend said chakra to trigger more powerful abilities! Playing the right card at the right time is key to defeating the villain and saving the village, so work together as a ninja team to strike when the time is right!

Whether you're a fan of the anime or simply enjoy cooperative games, Boruto: Naruto Next Generations - The Board Game offers something for everyone thanks to its easy-to-understand rules and deep game choices!

Name: Popit Chess
Description:
Take turns rolling the dice and pop the corresponding number of bubbles on your side. First to pop all his bubbles wins.

Or speed mode: both players keep rolling one die as fast as they can and pop the bubbles to finish first.
